channel.title: A few questions about Ubuntu
channel.description:
Hi, I just have a few questions about Ubuntu and I was wondering if someone could answer them. I got a new laptop not too long ago and I was considering switching to, or dual booting with Ubuntu. So I'd like to know:
1. What makes Ubuntu better than Windows XP (other than security reasons)? 2. Is there any way I can test out Ubuntu without installing it on my computer (I have an Ubuntu live CD)?
Thanks in advance to anyone that might be able to help me out. :)
If this is in the wrong place, feel free to move it.

item.title: A few questions about Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @Schizzo Schizzo
item.description:
@Schizzo wrote:

I see, thanks Ghost and Kmb :). If anyone else has anything else, feel free to add on.

Read full topic

item.title: A few questions about Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @ghostboy195 ghostboy195
item.description:
@ghostboy195 wrote:

  1. you could use that fancy live cd you have and put it in your cd drive and boot from it at startup. you might have to configure your bios to boot from the cd though.

Read full topic
